terms.Initialization Vector (IV): Random value used as the initial chaining value in CBC mode
terms.PKCS#7 Padding: Padding scheme that appends N bytes each of value N
terms.Column-major order: Memory layout where columns are stored consecutively
terms.Round Key: 16-byte key for a single AES round
terms.Endianness: Byte ordering of multi-byte values in memory
terms.Affine Transformation: Linear transform plus constant used in S-box
terms.RotWord: Cyclic left rotation of a 4-byte word
terms.SubWord: S-box substitution applied to each byte of a word
terms.Rcon: Round constant providing asymmetry in key expansion
terms.Key Expansion: Algorithm to derive round keys from cipher key
terms.Electronic Codebook (ECB): Block cipher mode where each block is encrypted independently
terms.Cipher Block Chaining (CBC): Block cipher mode where each block is XORed with previous ciphertext before encryption
terms.Counter (CTR): Block cipher mode that turns the cipher into a stream cipher by encrypting a counter
terms.Nonce: Number used once; combined with counter in CTR mode
terms.Padding Oracle Attack: Attack exploiting error messages from invalid padding to decrypt ciphertext
terms.Semantic Security: Property that identical plaintexts produce indistinguishable ciphertexts
terms.Keystream: Stream of pseudorandom bytes generated by encrypting counter values in CTR mode
terms.Fail-Fast: Immediate error reporting on detection of invalid state
terms.Constant-Time Comparison: Comparison algorithm whose execution time does not depend on data values
terms.Zeroization: Setting sensitive data to zero in memory after use
terms.Known Answer Tests (KATs): Precomputed test vectors with known inputs and outputs
terms.Reversibility: Property that decryption perfectly inverts encryption
terms.Test Harness: Framework for organizing and running tests
terms.Valgrind: Tool for detecting memory leaks and errors
terms.NIST Test Vectors: Official test cases published by the National Institute of Standards and Technology
terms.Inverse Cipher: AES decryption algorithm that reverses encryption transformations
terms.Authenticated Encryption: Encryption that provides both confidentiality and integrity protection
terms.GCM: Galois/Counter Mode, an authenticated encryption mode
terms.Side-Channel Resistance: Property of not leaking secret information through timing, power, etc.
terms.Constant-Time: Algorithm whose execution time doesn't depend on secret data
terms.SIMD: Single Instruction Multiple Data, parallel processing instructions
terms.AES-NI: AES New Instructions, hardware acceleration for AES
terms.Key Wrap: Algorithm for encrypting cryptographic keys with integrity protection
terms.XTS: XEX-based Tweaked CodeBook mode for disk encryption
terms.GHASH: Galois Hash function used in GCM authentication
